Dear Ms. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 showed an inappropriate video to Youth A.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed on 09/19/2024 and had no
additional information to provide.
The DHHS Foster Care Worker for Youth A provided information
over email on 09/17/2024. She expressed no concerns over the
safety of the youth at the facility. DHHS Foster Care Worker had
not heard from Youth A of any of the concerns in the allegations.
The facility’s Chief Administrator was interviewed with DHHS
Worker 1 during a face-to-face visit to the facility on 09/19/2024.
She confirmed both Staff 1 and Staff 2 involved in the allegations
had been placed on administrative leave pending the investigation
and provided written statements that had already been provided to
her by staff.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during a face-to-
face visit to the facility on 09/19/2024. Youth A stated Staff 1 had
shown him a video on her cell phone of herself engaging in sexual
activity. He stated he had heard rumors from other youth that
Staff 2 had shown Youth A this video, and that was not true.
Youth A stated he knew Staff 2 was not involved in this situation
because he was a “good staff.” Youth A recalled this occurring
after he had heard rumors from other youth about the existence of
this video. He stated this occurred one day about a month prior
when he was in the pod with other youth and staff. Youth A stated
Staff 1 was standing by the control room door and waved him over
to her. Youth A did not believe anyone else would have seen this.
Youth A stated he approached Staff 1, who then pulled her cell
phone out of her pocket and showed him a video of herself
performing sexual acts. Youth A stated this only lasted for a few
seconds, and he then walked away. Youth A recalled Staff 1 not
2

saying anything to him as this occurred. Youth A did not tell
anyone about this at first. He stated that, sometime later, he was
talking to a peer that he could not remember, about the video and
Staff 1 heard him. Youth A remembered Staff 1 writing him up for
this inappropriate conversation. On that same day, Youth A
recalled hearing Staff 1 and Staff 2 arguing with each other, and
Staff 1 stating something to the effect of “I’m gonna have
someone kill you in the parking lot.” Youth A confirmed the first
person at the facility that he told about this video and Staff 1 was
the Chief Administrator a few days prior to this interview.
A child advocacy center interview for Youth A was scheduled for
10/08/2024. Youth A attended this interview but declined to speak
on the allegations, despite the information previously provided.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during a face-to-
face visit to the facility on 09/19/2024. He stated he had not seen
any alleged inappropriate videos shown to youth by staff and had
not heard of other youth seeing anything similar. Youth B
confirmed he was placed in the same pod as Youth A. Youth B
believed there were times that staff had their phones on their
person, but most of the time they did not as that was the facility
policy for staff.
Youth C was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during a face-to-
face visit to the facility on 09/19/2024. Youth C stated he has not
seen any inappropriate videos shown to him by staff. Youth C did
recall hearing other youth talk in sexually inappropriate language
about Staff 1. He stated this included a rumor that Staff 1 was in a
sexually inappropriate video and other youth had seen it, but
Youth C did not know if this was true and stated he had not been
shown anything inappropriate like that from staff. Youth C stated
staff almost always do not have their phones on their person while
on the floor with youth anyway, but there have been times that he
could not specify, when it appeared that a staff member had their
cell phone with them while supervising youth. Youth C recalled
witnessing Staff 1 and Staff 2 in what he believed was a “heated
argument” on one occasion but could not confirm what they were
discussing.
Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F were interviewed separately with
DHHS Worker 2 on 10/03/2024 during a previously announced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. They all denied ever being shown
any videos by staff on their cell phones, inappropriate or
otherwise.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/10/2024. She denied ever showing youth at the facility
inappropriate videos on her cell phone, in addition denying that
she has shown youth anything at all on her phone or has her
phone on her person while on the floor with youth. Staff 1 stated
she had heard rumors from other staff and youth that there was a
video that was shown to youth of herself engaging in sexual
activity. Staff 1 recalled one specific instance of this when Youth A
commented to her that he would not “respect no bitch that is in a
porn video.” Staff 1 stated this comment was made after she had
asked Youth A to step down in preparation for bedtime
procedures. Staff 1 did not question Youth A further after this
comment on how he knew of or heard of such a video, she stated
that she wanted to ask around other staff herself. Staff 1 believed
other youth heard this comment from Youth A. Staff 1 recalled
asking Youth B if he had seen the video or heard of it. She stated
that she asked Youth B specifically because she believed he knew
something about it, and he was present and heard Youth A’s
previous comment to her. Youth B reported to Staff 1 that Staff 2
had shown it to him. Staff 1 believed this to be true because of
the description of the video that Youth B provided in describing it
to Staff 1. Staff 1 recalled confronting Staff 2 about this that same
day and arguing with him, with Staff 2 denying that he did so.
Manager 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1
on 10/10/2024. She confirmed that her first knowledge of the
allegations occurred when Staff 1 came to her on 09/13/2024 to
discuss them with her. Staff 1 reported to her she had knowledge
that Staff 2 had shown an inappropriate video on his cell phone to
youth at the facility. Manager 1 stated she then reported the
concerns to the Chief Administrator.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/10/2024. Staff 2 denied showing any videos at all, including
anything inappropriate, to youth at the facility. He confirmed he
was aware of the rumor going around the facility that Staff 1 had
been involved in a sexual video and some staff and youth were
either aware of it or had been discussing it, but he denied any
involvement in this. Staff 2 stated he had known Staff 1 from high
school and prior to their work at the facility, and also stated he
rarely worked on the same pods as her. Staff 2 stated he had
heard other staff discussing this allegation in the previous weeks
but had not heard any youth speak of it. Staff 2 confirmed that
Staff 1 had addressed this allegation directly with him on one
occasion, and this discussion quickly turned into an argument.
Staff 2 believed Youth B was nearby and may have heard this.
4

Staff 2 stated he requested to management that he not work with
Staff 1 after this occurred.
Manager 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1
on 10/10/2024. Manager 2 stated her only knowledge of the
allegations were that Staff 1 informed her a youth from one
specific pod had recently called Staff 1 a nickname involving
pornography terminology, and Staff 1 did not know where they
would have gotten any knowledge of such an inappropriate video.
During a video conference call, on 10/18/2024 DHHS Worker 1
stated her investigation had not yet been completed and could not
comment on possible findings.
Staff 3 was interviewed over on 10/18/2024. She stated she was
aware of the allegations due to Staff 2 discussing them with her.
Staff 3 stated the context of this conversation with Staff 2 involved
Staff 2 denying that he had seen a video of this nature or shown
any inappropriate videos to youth in the facility. Staff 3 stated she
thought there was a possibility of a youth having seen an
inappropriate video on a computer after they had recently stolen
one and accessed inappropriate websites. Staff 3 could not
provide any details on who this was or any other corroboration.
Documentation reviewed:
• A written statement from Youth A directed to the Chief
Administrator regarding the allegations was provided. In
this statement Youth A stated he knew that the video
shown to him by Staff 1 involved her, that he knew that
Staff 1 showed the video to other residents, and that Staff 2
had also shown the video to residents as well. He did not
describe how he knew these alleged details.
• Separate written statements from Youth B and Youth C
were received, both denying that they had been shown any
inappropriate videos by staff.
• A written statement regarding the allegations dated
09/17/2024 and authored by Staff 1 was received. In this
statement she detailed a similar course of events as she
provided in her interview for the investigation, including
denying that she showed anyone an inappropriate video
and she asked other youth if they had seen the alleged
video before reporting this concern up to management.
• Facility policy titled “Cell phone/Smart devices policy” last
dated 11/09/2023 was provided and reviewed. This policy
directed staff to leave any cell phone and smart watch
5

within the employee locker room and prohibited them in any
areas of the building serving youth.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence
found that any staff have shown an inappropriate video to youth at
the facility.
Technical Assistance provided:
• The facility is advised to discuss ways to help staff ensure
that only appropriate conversations occur around youth,
and any inappropriate discussions that either staff or youth
have been stopped to the best of staff’s ability and
addressed properly. Over the course of this investigation
there was consistency in interviews with staff and youth
where the rumor of an allegation of an inappropriate video
involving Staff 1 appeared to have been too freely
discussed prior to the involvement of the administrative
team.
Consultation provided:
• During her interview regarding the allegations, Staff 1 noted
that she would not have shown a video of this nature to the
youth at the facility because she has relationships with
them “like they are her nephews” and she likes to “kick it
with them.” The facility is advised to assess training and
messaging around successful staff relationships with the
youth in how a balance of rapport and familiarity can be
managed with respect for boundaries and programming.
• When receiving written statements from any staff or youth
regarding allegations, ensure that these documents are
dated.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff stated that they intentionally did not include pertinent
information on facility documentation.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during a face-to-
face visit to the facility on 09/19/2024. He stated he was talking to
a peer that he could not remember, about the video and Staff 1
heard him. Youth A remembered Staff 1 writing him up for this
inappropriate conversation. On that same day, Youth A recalled
hearing Staff 1 and Staff 2 arguing with each other, and Staff 1
stating something to the effect of “I’m gonna have someone kill
you in the parking lot.”
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/10/2024. In her description of an inappropriate comment made
to her by Youth A where he referred to an alleged sexual video,
Staff 1 noted that she wrote up Youth A. She stated that she
wrote up Youth A for not “stepping down” and listening to her
directives but chose not to include the inappropriate comment that
Youth A made. Staff 1 stated she did this purposefully in that she
wanted to find out more from other staff as to where knowledge of
this video may have come from. Staff 1 commented she has
written up youth for making inappropriate comments as she has
been trained on, but did not do so in this instance because she did
not want the existence of such a video known and she wanted to
know more about who knew about it.
Documentation reviewed:
• A “Rule Violation and Disciplinary Consequence record”
dated 08/13/2024 written by Staff 1 was provided. This
was regarding Youth A and stated that on that date Youth A
“continued negative behaviors” by refusing to go back to
their room and continuing to disrespect staff.
• Facility policy for employees titled “Employee Ethics Policy”
was provided and reviewed. This is provided to all
employees at the time of hire, and stated that standards of
conduct include the avoidance of misrepresentation and
respect of the truth while engaged in agency business.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance per staff interviews and
documentation reviewed. Staff 1 intentionally did not include
pertinent information on documentation involving youth discipline.
7
